Description: Earring; gold; one of a pair; the top composed of two ogees with roundels, one containing a stone; hinged to this are three pendants, each with three square or circular settings (all but one are empty); the left and right pendants terminate in a rock emerald and a pearl, while the central pendant terminates in a small pearl and a sapphire.
Curator's comments: Published: L. Wamser, Die Welt von Byzanz - Europas ostliches Erbe - Glanz, Krisen, und Fortleben einer tausendjahrigen Kultur, Munich, 2004, no. 495. Pair with 1916,0714.3
Bibliographic references: Tait 1986a / Seven Thousand Years of Jewellery (222)
Baldini Lippolis 1999 / L'oreficeria nell'Impero di Costantinopoli tra IV e VII secolo (2.II.5.c.8)
Fluck et al. 2015 / Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs (p.75)
Dennison 1918 / A Gold Treasure of the Late Roman Period from Egypt (19)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015, Oct 29 – 2016, Feb 7. British Museum, Room 35. Egypt: Faith after the Pharoahs 2015 1 April - 15 Sept. Berlin, Bode Museum, 'EIN GOTT - Abrahams Erben am Nil' 2004 21 Oct-2005 3 Apr, Germany, Munich, Archäologische Staatssammlung, The World of Byzantium
